sentences.sContent: Or it could be that the needles caused a “super placebo” effect, triggering a real reaction in the brain that changes the way the body perceives and responds to pain.
sentences.sContent_eng: Or it could be that the needles caused a “super placebo” effect, triggering a real reaction in the brain that changes the way the body perceives and responds to pain.
sentences.sCn: 或者是因为针灸造成了一种“超级安慰剂”效应，并触发了大脑内的一个反应，这种反应能改变身体对疼痛信号的感知和回应。

remMethod.val: plac(平静的) + ebo → 安慰剂

trans.tranCn: 为死者所诵的晚祷词, 安慰剂
trans.tranOther: when someone feels better after taking a placebo, even though it has not had any effect on their body
